Documents/Programming/Projects/SSYAlert/Ex-Project-Categories/NSHelpManager+HelpForHelp.h

00001 #import <Cocoa/Cocoa.h>
00002 
00003 @interface NSHelpManager (HelpForHelp)
00004 /* Provides a workaround for Apple Bug 4212853, duplicate 3946514,
00005 which is that help anchors will not be scrolled to on a newly-
00006 opened page which has a link to an external CSS document.  This
00007 bug is apparently in Help Viewer because it is seen whether
00008 you use Cocoa, Carbon or AppleScript direct from Script Editor.
00009 The first two methods are replacments for -openHelpAnchor:inBook:
00010 and the last one is a little bonus.  */
00011 
00012 + (void)openAnchor:(NSString*)anchor 
00013  neighboringAnchor:(NSString*)neighboringAnchor ;
00014         // neighboringAnchor is any other anchor on same page as anchor
00015 
00016 + (void)openAnchor:(NSString*)anchor ;
00017         // If anchor is simply an anchor, may or may not scroll depending
00018         // on whether or not Apple bug 4212853 applies
00019         // If anchor is of the form @"anchor|neighboringAnchor",
00020         // that is two anchors separated by a pipe, then it invokes
00021         // openAnchor:neighboringAnchor and tries the bug workaround.
00022 + (void)openPage:(NSString*)page ;
00023         // Cocoa wrapper for function only available in Carbon.
00024 
00025 @end
